page.title: 19The Sneyd Inn,Bloxwich.
page.content: Originally a farm house,the Sneyd Inn is near the original route of the Wyrley and Essington Canal.It began by providing refreshment for the boatees. Now the canal has been filled in and an access road,Vernon Way,has been built to the new Sneyd School.Trade is seasonal increasing in the summer when people visit the nearby reservoir, although there are quite a lot of regulars.Few spirits are sold since most customers drink beer.On average 10 hogsheads of mild and 2 barrels each of bitter and lager are sold weekly,prices being 58p,62p,and 72p respectively.Snacks are available at the weekend.There are 2 rooms,a bar and a childrens room.The landlady starts work at 7.00a.m. including cleaning,bookwork,stocktaking,taking deliveries as well as serving.Opening hours are 12.00-2.30,6.00-10.30.
